intro: Stillingia brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian stellaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Stillingia brasiliensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
